Student_Athletic_Team_Membership_Data.description: Primary Athletic Team. This field identifies whether a particular athletic team is designated as the primary team for a particular student.

Student_Athletic_Team_Membership_Data.description: Valid assignment types are Add, Remove, and Update.

description: Contains the student's athletic team assignment and all corresponding snapshots.

validation.validation: To add a Student to an Athletic Team, the Athletic Team must be in Active status.
An Athletic Team Membership Event is already in progress for this student and this Athletic Team.
To add an Academic Record to an athletic team, the Academic Record must be Active.
The institution of the student's Academic Record must match the institution of the Athletic Team.
Specify either an Academic Period or a Snapshot Effective Date. If you specify an Academic Period, the effective date will be the first day of that Academic Period.
Assignment Type Reference must be set to Add, Remove, or Update.
Specify an Academic Period that is valid for this student’s Academic Record.
Select an Effective Date that is [on or after] the membership date of [date].
Specify Athletic Roles that match the institution of the student's Academic Record.
Specify Athletic Roles that are valid for the Athletic Team.
If a student is added back to a team that they were previously on, specify an effective date on or after the previous removal date.
Specify an Athletic Status that is valid for the Athletic Team.
Specify a removal date that is on or after the current effective date.
Specify an Athletic Status that matches the institution of the student's Academic Record.
Specify an Athletic Status that is active.
Specify Athletic Roles that are active.
When removing a student from a team, you can't update the Athletic Role Reference of the student.
When removing a student from a team, you can't update the Athletic Status Reference of the student.
To add a Student to an Athletic Team, they can't already be a member of that team.
To remove a Student from an Athletic Team, they must be a current member of that team and you must specify the academic record associated with the membership.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.
